title: Which websites do you use to listen music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Best may vary for every individual but here are my opinions for top five this year: SpotifyPro: Straight forward and really simple to usePro: Offers free subscriptionPro: Has large music catalogPro: Users can search a specific song or album they would like to listen to.Con: The free plan has great limitation (The sound quality is low, with 160kbps quality compared to 320kbps in Premium service, and also advertisements in the free service can be intrusive.)Con: The song can't be downloaded even with the Spotify Premium plan.Con: Not available in most countriesCon: After 6 months of free listening users are limited to 10 hours per month of listening.PandoraPro: Offers free and premium servicePro: Access to millions of songs with Pandora PremiumPro: Pandora’s selected songs algorithm is great for discovering new musicCon: For freemium there is a limit of six songs per artist hour.Con: Be ready to listen to audio ads before music when not on a paid plan.Con: “Rewind and repeat” is not possible.Con: Only available in New Zealand, US, and Australia.BitbyndPro: Offers unlimited music for freePro: Has large music catalogPro: With zero adsPro: Users can search directly for songs and albums and can also create custom playlists.Con: Music download option was recently removedCon: Server inconsistency due to high trafficTidalPro: Large collection of music with very high qualityPro: With a month free trial for new usersPro: Available for all countriesPro: Supports Playlist import and exportCon: Quite expensive ($9.99 a month option that only gives you audio at low quality, and another $19.99 service that delivers the high-quality)SoundCloudPro: With highly active communityPro: Great place to discover new artistsCon: Not the best for choosing tracks you want to listen to

I get my free and public domain sheet music on Free Public Domain Sheet Music musictheory.net is one of the most helpful websites for learning that subject.  Lots of people read about contemporary music on Pitchfork A ton of independent Hip Hop (and now spreading out to other genres) use Page on soundcloud.com And Bandcamp  to distribute their music- they feature a streaming option. If you want to broaden your horizons based around music you already like, check out Pandora Internet Radio - Listen to Free Music You'll Love  Your question, however, is vague and therefore hard to answer. Music sites to do what? To learn about what? To discuss what?
